company.name: Incentive Services, Inc.
company.business_description: Incentive Services, Inc. works with organizations to improve performance of individual employees through service award programs (for work anniversaries, retirement, onboarding, etc.), performance incentives, and loyalty programs.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Incentive Services, Inc., a Minnesota corporation, displayed privacy policy statements on its website claiming it adhered to the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks. In reality, the company never completed the self-certification process required to participate in either framework. Although Respondent initiated an application with the U.S. Department of Commerce, it failed to complete the necessary steps and continued to publish the false Privacy Shield compliance claims on its website. This conduct constitutes a deceptive act or practice in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed to adhere to the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Frameworks as part of its self-regulatory compliance
representations_made.quoted_text: We regularly review our compliance with our Privacy Policy. We also adhere to several self-regulatory frameworks, including the EU-US and Swiss-US Privacy Shield Frameworks…

counts.title: Privacy Shield Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represented, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it was a participant in the EU-U.S. and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.
counts.fact: Respondent was never certified to participate in either the EU-U.S. or the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 13 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: Incentive Services, Inc., a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations about Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any way its membership in, compliance with, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization, including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in, compliance with, certification by, or endorsement by any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework, and the APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and business entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of this Order to the Commission within ten (10) days after the effective date
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For twenty (20) years after issuance, deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers/members, employees with managerial responsibilities related to the Order's subject matter, agents, representatives, and any resulting business entity from structural changes; delivery within ten (10) days for current personnel and before assuming responsibilities for all others
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct Page 2 of 5 related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.
requirements.deadline: 10 days for current personnel; before assuming responsibilities for all others

requirements.description: Obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order from each individual or entity to whom it was delivered, within thirty (30) days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report 60 days after issuance, and timely sworn notices of changes in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy proceedings.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance report 60 days after issuance identifying contact information, all businesses, describing activities, detailing compliance with each provision, and providing copies of acknowledgments
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated contact points or in the structure of Respondent or any entity it owns or controls that may affect compliance obligations, including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of relevant entities
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within 14 days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: Any submission required to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate, comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, and include the required declaration language, date, signatory's full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed in writing, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, FTC, with the subject line beginning: In re Incentive Services, Inc., FTC File No. 1923078
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to Page 3 of 5 the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Incentive Services, Inc., FTC File No. 1923078.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific records for 20 years after issuance, with each record retained for at least 5 years, covering financials, personnel, compliance documentation, and representations subject to the Order.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold, for 20 years after issuance (retaining each record for 5 years)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for twenty (20) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records showing each service provider's name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination (if applicable)
requirements.quoted_text: B. personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: C. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each widely disseminated representation subject to this Order and all materials relied upon in making that representation
requirements.quoted_text: D. a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, interviewing affiliated individuals, and using other lawful investigative means including undercover contacts.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of a written request from a Commission representative, submit additional sworn compliance reports or other requested information and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview (interviewee may have counsel present)
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, without identification or prior notice; nothing in this Order limits the Commission's use of compulsory process under Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification Page 4 of 5 or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on January 23, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate

requirements.description: Order terminates January 23, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later; filing such a complaint does not affect provisions terminating in less than 20 years, respondents not named as defendants, or a terminated order
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.

requirements.description: If a complaint is dismissed or a court rules no violation occurred and that ruling is not appealed or is upheld on appeal, the Order terminates as though the complaint had never been filed, except it will not terminate between the filing date and the later of the appeal deadline or the date the ruling is upheld
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate January 23, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
